revision.text: ==English== ===Etymology=== From {{prefix|en|yester|tide|t2=time, season, period}}. ===Noun=== {{en-noun|-}} # A [[time]] [[period]] previous to the [[present]]; the [[past]]. ====Synonyms==== * {{l|en|foretime}}, {{l|en|yestertime}}; see also [[Thesaurus:the past]] ===Adverb=== {{en-adv|-}} # In times past, at a prior time; in the past. #* {{quote-journal|en|year=1905|last=Williams|first=Dr. Frederick H.|title=Fair Cooling Spray, O Lovely Sea!|journal=The Connecticut Magazine|volume=9|number=3|pageurl=https://archive.org/details/connecticutmagazv9p2hart/page/n13|page=frontispiece|passage=Fair cooling spray, oh, lovely sea! / How maiden coy thy changing mood; / To-night thou'rt sweet with smiles for me, / Scarce '''yestertide''' I vainly wooed / Thy fretful features for a smile, / Naught could for me one thought beguile.}} #* {{quote-book|en|year=1889|first=Alfred|last=Austin|title=The Human Tragedy|passage=And loudly to her lovers called, to leap To arms for her sore sake, that '''yestertide''' In her delight delighted, and drank deep Of her lascivious wine-cups, {{...}}}} ====Synonyms==== * {{l|en|beforehand}}, {{l|en|yestertime}}; see also [[Thesaurus:formerly]]
